intro: Endostemon tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly endostemon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy, or tomentose, foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
